content: Can you provide an example of how to change the background color of a paragraph in HTML code to a specific color?

Certainly! To change the background color of a paragraph in HTML, you can use inline CSS, internal CSS, or an external stylesheet. Here’s an example using inline CSS to change the background color of a paragraph to a specific color, such as light blue: ```html Change Background Color

This is a paragraph with a light blue background.

``` If you prefer using internal CSS, you can do it like this: ```html Change Background Color

This is a paragraph with a light blue background.

``` Alternatively, if you want to use an external stylesheet, you would have a separate CSS file, say `styles.css`, with the following content: ```css .colored-background { background-color: lightblue; } ``` Then, link this stylesheet in your HTML file: ```html Change Background Color

This is a paragraph with a light blue background.

``` These methods will change the background color of the paragraph to light blue. You can replace `lightblue` with any other color name, hex code, or RGB value to suit your needs.
